author: Abhimanyu Ghoshal
title: Microsoft announces Skype Lite for low connectivity areas, launching in India first
text:
35 shares 
At its Future Decoded event in Mumbai, India, today, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella announced the launch of Skype Lite , a retooled version of its voice and video calling service, designed for use in areas with limited connectivity on Android devices. 
The new app takes up just 13MB of space and will support nine regional languages, as well as chatbots for connected services. It also lets you read and reply to SMS messages, and includes a tool to help you track your mobile data usage.
